title: Kerala High Court orders payment of pension, allowances to Ciza Thomas
content: In the absence of pending departmental or judicial proceedings, government cannot withhold her pensionary benefits, says court. After retirement from service, she was appointed V-C of KTU by the then Governor Arif Mohammed Khan

title: LDF accuses UDF of cobbling together a rainbow coalition of communal forces in Nilambur bypoll
content: LDF convener T.P. Ramakrishnan says UDF lacks a credible development and social welfare agenda to offer Nilambur’s electorate

title: Moonwalk movie review: A heartfelt tribute to the breakdancing subculture
content: In Moonwalk, debutant filmmaker Vinod A.K. makes a bold attempt for the latter and lands stylishly on his toes, evoking the iconic dance move of the early 1990s

title: Take steps for protection of wetlands, officials of Annamayya district told
content: District Collector holds review meeting with officials on preparations for World Environment Day celebrations

title: Allocate ₹300 crore to purchase produce from tobacco farmers, CPI(M) urges Andhra Pradesh government
content: The government should discuss with the traders and procure at least 25% of tobacco through the STC. If the government starts taking action, the companies will compete to purchase tobacco, says the party State secretary

title: Inclement weather fails to dampen spirits of yoga practitioners; thousands fill streets for Yogandhra-2025
content: The Minister, Collector, and Joint Collector also visited the Ramanarayanam temple premises, where people were practicing yoga, and interacted with them

title: Serve cardholders sincerely, Civil Supplies Minister tells ration dealers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Gear up for distribution of essential goods at ration shops from June 1, says Nadendla Manohar; goods will be supplied at the doorstep of persons aged above 65 and those with disabilities, he adds

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: US, QUAD nations trying to force India into military alliance, not just trade: Russia
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov claimed India joined the QUAD for trade, but other members push for military exercises. He warned of a militarization agenda, urging India to see the "provocation." Lavrov also advocated reviving the Russia-India-China (RIC) trilateral mechanism, citing improved India-China border relations, and criticized Western attempts to divide India and China.

title: Hardik Pandya includes 150kph rocket vs Gujarat Titans
content: In a crucial IPL 2025 Eliminator clash, Mumbai Indians opted to bat first after Hardik Pandya won the toss against Gujarat Titans in Mullanpur. Mumbai Indians made three changes, bringing in Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson, and Raj Angad Bawa. The winner of this match will go on to face Punjab Kings in the Qualifier 2 Ahmedabad.

title: Jihadi content, madrasa attack & murders: Inside Bengal engineer’s 'terror trail'
content: Humayun Kabir, a Jadavpur University graduate, was arrested for murdering his parents in Memari. He also attacked four teachers at a Bongaon orphanage. Kabir was found to be radicalized and browsing jihadi literature. He had lost his job and was divorced. Police are investigating his extremist links and a possible plan to flee to Bangladesh.

title: Satya Nadella to employees in Town Hall: 6000 job cuts were related to…
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella attributed recent layoffs to reorganization rather than performance, impacting even product development roles. The company is aggressively pushing its Copilot AI assistants, securing a significant deal with Barclays for 100,000 licenses. While adoption is growing, some clients are proceeding cautiously, awaiting clearer returns on Microsoft's AI investments.

title: Inside story of Elon Musk's drug use
content: Musk’s drug use didn’t begin on the campaign trail—it simply became more public, more intense, and, crucially, more consequential. The Wall Street Journal had already reported in 2023 that some Tesla board members were concerned about his substance use, including Ambien, the sleep aid that Musk once claimed helped him stop "overthinking." But according to The Times, what followed in 2024–25 was a full-spectrum spiral.

title: Bold gamble! Why MI handed three surprise debuts vs GT
content: Mumbai Indians elected to bat after winning the toss against Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2025 Eliminator. Hardik Pandya cited a batting-friendly pitch as the reason behind the decision. MI made three changes, bringing in Bairstow, Gleeson, and Bawa, while GT included Mendis and Sundar in place of Buttler and Arshad Khan.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: 'Incapable of waging war': Shah lauds BSF for destroying Pak's communication system
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the Border Security Force (BSF) for their decisive response to Pakistan's aggression following Operation Sindoor. Shah stated that the BSF destroyed 118 Pakistani posts in three days, dismantling their surveillance network. He emphasized the significant blow to Pakistan's communication and surveillance capabilities, asserting it would take years to recover.

title: DGCA grants IndiGo 3-month extension on Turkish airlines wet lease agreement
content: Amidst rising diplomatic tensions between India and Turkiye, the DGCA has granted IndiGo a three-month extension for its wet lease agreement with Turkish Airlines. This allows IndiGo to continue operating two Boeing 777s on the Delhi and Mumbai to Istanbul routes.

title: Stephen Miller's wife Katie Miller is following Elon Musk 'full time'
content: Katie Miller, spokeswoman for the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), is leaving the White House to join Elon Musk's ventures after Musk's departure from his advisory role. This transition follows Musk's criticism of the "One Big Beautiful Bill," prompting responses from both Millers.

title: Which US university has the highest percentage of international students?
content: Harvard University is battling the Trump administration’s attempt to block it from enrolling international students, citing violations of legal procedures. A federal judge has temporarily halted the order, highlighting broader tensions between the administration and higher education. International students contribute $43.8 billion annually to the US economy, yet hostile policies are driving them toward countries like Canada and Japan. Data shows that top US universities have international enrollments exceeding 40%, raising concerns over future academic and financial stability.

title: BPSC 2025: Notification for DSO/AD posts released; applications open from June 3
content: Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has announced recruitment for 47 District Statistical Officer (DSO) and Assistant Director (AD) posts under Advt. No. 38/2025. Online applications will be accepted from June 3 to June 24, 2025. Candidates must hold a master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics. The preliminary exam is scheduled for August 3, 2025. Detailed vacancy and reservation information, eligibility criteria, and application instructions are available on the official BPSC website.

title: Revised Canadian policy eases job transitions for foreign workers
content: Canada has introduced a policy effective May 27, allowing temporary foreign workers to change jobs faster while awaiting work permit processing. This benefits workers, including many from India, by reducing downtime and enabling better opportunities. Immigration consultant Kubeir Kamal highlights the positive impact on Indian workers in sectors like IT and healthcare.

title: India’s Q4 GDP growth beats estimates at 7.4% - Top points
content: India's economy exceeded expectations with a 7.4% growth in the fourth quarter of FY 2024-25. However, the full fiscal year GDP growth is provisionally estimated at 6.5%, marking a four-year low compared to previous years.

title: K Kavitha or KTR? BRS caught in ‘succession’ crossfire
content: As the Bharat Rashtra Samithi celebrates its silver jubilee, a power struggle seems to be emerging between KCR's children, KTR and Kavitha, fueled by dissatisfaction over party control and influence. Kavitha's discontent surfaced after expressing concerns about KCR's speech and her perceived sidelining within the party, leading her to independently pursue initiatives.

title: WWE SmackDown preview: Full match card, confirmed segments, how to watch and more
content: SmackDown on May 30, 2025, from Knoxville, Tennessee, will feature John Cena and Cody Rhodes under one roof before their Money in the Bank tag team match. Andrade, Jacob Fatu, and Carmelo Hayes will battle in a Men's MITB Qualifying match, while Jade Cargill, Nia Jax, and Naomi compete for the women's spot. Bianca Belair will also make her homecoming.

title: 'More famous now': Pahalgam terror attack plotter at Lahore rally
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Saifullah Kasuri, a key plotter in the Pahalgam terror attack, delivered an inflammatory anti-India speech in Lahore, surrounded by Pakistani security forces and ISI officials. He boasted about his notoriety following the attack, sharing the stage with US-designated terrorist Talha Saeed. "I have become more famous since being accused of the attack," he gloated, as per information reaching here.

title: UN declares Gaza the only region where 100% of population faces famine risk
content: The United Nations reports a dire situation in Gaza. Every person there faces famine. Chaos and desperation grip the region. Israeli strikes killed police officers trying to control looting. Aid distribution faces immense challenges. People struggle to get food. Ceasefire talks are ongoing. A new proposal was presented but rejected. The conflict continues to cause immense suffering.

title: 'No country backed India': Cong says BJP’s 'foreign policy failed' post-Op Sindoor
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized the BJP government's foreign policy following Operation Sindoor, citing diplomatic failures and compromised national security. Allegations include a lack of international support, growing ties between Pakistan and other nations, and questions surrounding the neutralization of key terrorists. Shashi Tharoor voiced disappointment over condolences for those killed in Pakistan.

title: 'Who is this guy?': Virat Kohli's reaction on Musheer Khan goes viral
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a dominant eight-wicket victory against Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, reaching their first IPL final since 2016. Punjab's batting collapse led to a paltry 101, which RCB chased down swiftly. However, the match was marred by controversy as Virat Kohli faced criticism for allegedly taunting debutant Musheer Khan, sparking a social media debate regarding sportsmanship.

title: Taylor Swift rumored to join Kelce in Kansas City for star-studded charity weekend
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift is rumoured to grace Kansas City's Big Slick Celebrity Weekend, supporting her beau Travis Kelce. Kelce, back from Florida training, is participating in the charity event benefiting Children’s Mercy Hospital. Swift's potential appearance has ignited excitement, especially after her previous visit to the hospital in December.

title: Ankita Bhandari murder: Court sentences ex-BJP minister’s son Pulkit Arya, two aides
content: In Kotdwar, a court convicted Pulkit Arya, Saurabh Bhaskar, and Ankit Gupta for the murder of a 19-year-old receptionist, sentencing them to life imprisonment. The prosecution proved the victim was pressured for 'extra services' and killed after refusing. Arya, son of an ex-BJP leader, also faces charges of sexual harassment, sparking widespread protests and a SIT investigation.

title: AIIMS study reveals sharp rise in obesity among private school kids in Delhi
content: An AIIMS study, backed by ICMR, reveals a stark health disparity among Delhi school children. Childhood is when habits are shaped — and so is health. Ignoring signs of obesity or undernutrition can lead to irreversible consequences. Schools, parents, and communities need to step in not just with health tips.

title: Why is Anushka Sharma blamed in defeat but forgotten in victory?
content: Anushka Sharma faced online criticism during Virat Kohli's team losses, labeled as a distraction. However, after RCB's recent victory, fans defended her against double standards, questioning why she's blamed during defeats but not praised during wins. Social media buzzed with support, highlighting her presence as a lucky charm, while Virat Kohli's heartfelt birthday post for Anushka melted hearts.

title: 'This journey will not ... ': Jasprit Bumrah reveals retirement plans
content: Jasprit Bumrah, India's pace spearhead, contemplates his retirement, emphasizing his commitment to the sport as long as his body and passion allow. Acknowledging the physical toll of international cricket, he highlights the importance of managing his workload and prioritizing key tournaments.

title: Watch: Nitish Kumar's latest 'Vajpayee' gaffe with PM Modi on stage
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, facing scrutiny over recent gaffes, mistakenly mentioned former PM Vajpayee instead of PM Modi at a public event, prompting opposition leaders like Tejashwi Yadav to question his health. Despite the error, Kumar praised the Modi government's development efforts in Bihar, highlighting infrastructure projects and welcoming the caste enumeration initiative.

title: Taylor Swift steps out in NYC as fans read into her reaction to AMAs "snub"
content: Pop icon Taylor Swift, recently spotted in New York City, sparked fan reactions regarding her AMAs absence and alleged involvement in the Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni situation. Despite not attending the event, fans lauded her confidence and success. Sources suggest Swift and Travis Kelce are serious about their relationship, potentially considering marriage and family in the future.

title: 'Days of broken highways, poor railways history': PM Modi in Bihar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched a strong critique of the Rashtriya Janata Dal and Lalu Yadav during a rally in Karakat, Bihar, asserting that the state's progress began with the end of "jungle raj." He highlighted the inauguration of the modernized Patna Airport terminal, Greenfield corridors, and new bridges.

title: How history now favours RCB: Qualifier 1 winners have dominated IPL finals
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) have advanced to the 2025 IPL final after defeating Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, marking their fourth final appearance. Historically, Qualifier 1 winners have a strong chance of winning the title, with 11 of the last 14 champions taking this route. RCB now have time to strategize for the final in Ahmedabad.

title: Putin lends his car to Shinzo Abe’s widow for Moscow theatre visit - video
content: Vladimir Putin met Akie Abe in Moscow. He offered condolences and a personal gesture. Putin lent her his car for a Bolshoi Theatre visit. He praised Shinzo Abe's efforts toward Russian-Japanese cooperation. Akie Abe expressed hope for continued cultural exchange. She mentioned her husband's desire to meet Putin even after the Ukraine situation.

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy says 'PoK would be ours if Rahul Gandhi were PM'
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy asserted that India would have reclaimed Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) if Rahul Gandhi had been Prime Minister. He criticized the BJP-led NDA government's hasty ceasefire with Pakistan after a military strike, questioning the lack of transparency and strategy. Reddy highlighted Rahul Gandhi's support for reclaiming PoK, contrasting it with the current government's approach.

title: Selfie gone wild: Indian attacked by tiger while posing for photo - watch video
content: An Indian tourist was attacked by a tiger at an animal park in Thailand while attempting to take a selfie. The incident, captured on video, sparked widespread criticism and reignited debates about animal cruelty and wildlife ethics. The man sustained minor injuries, and the video has drawn millions of views, raising concerns about risky tourist attractions.

title: 'There's a shark in the pond!': 20-foot predator startles Rhode Island diners
content: Memorial Day diners at Block Island's Dead Eye Dicks witnessed a startling sight: a massive 20-foot shark gliding through Great Salt Pond. The Atlantic Shark Institute reported the sighting, noting the shark's species is unidentified. Marine experts say such sightings are consistent with seasonal behavior as sharks follow prey closer to shore during warmer months.

title: Bureaucrat vs bureaucrat: IRS officer assaulted inside Income Tax office in Lucknow
content: An altercation between two IRS officers in Lucknow's Income Tax office escalated into violence, leaving officer Gaurav Garg injured. Garg was allegedly attacked by a senior colleague with a glass tumbler and paperweight. Police have registered an FIR, and Garg is currently out of danger.

title: Watch: Chief engineer throws bundles of Rs 500 notes from flat during raid
content: Odisha Vigilance Department recovered approximately Rs 2.1 crore in cash during raids at seven locations connected to Baikuntha Nath Sarangi, chief engineer in the state’s Rural Development Department, following allegations of disproportionate assets. Sarangi allegedly attempted to dispose of bundles of Rs 500 notes from his Bhubaneswar flat as vigilance officers arrived.

title: 'Will apologise only if I am wrong': Kamal Haasan defends 'Kannada from Tamil' remarks
content: Kamal Haasan faces backlash and boycott calls in Karnataka over his remark that "Kannada is born out of Tamil." He refuses to apologize unless proven wrong, dismissing threats from pro-Kannada groups. The Karnataka Film Chamber of Commerce has banned the release of his upcoming film 'Thug Life' in the state until he apologizes, escalating the cultural and political storm.

title: NEET PG in one shift: SC slams two-shift format as arbitrary and unfair
content: The Supreme Court of India has ordered that the National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test for Postgraduate (NEET-PG) 2025 will be held in one shift. This decision follows concerns about fairness in a two-shift format. The National Board of Examinations will adjust logistics. Medical aspirants and educators welcome the change. The exam is scheduled for June 15, 2025.

title: 'Right of self-defence': Tharoor 'disappointed' over Colombia's reaction to Op Sindoor
content: Shashi Tharoor expressed disappointment over Colombia's condolences for lives lost in Pakistan after India's counterstrike, emphasizing India's right to self-defense following the Pahalgam attack. He highlighted the lack of action from Pakistan against terrorists and presented evidence of Pakistani military officials attending terrorist funerals, underscoring Pakistan's complicity in supporting terrorism.

title: 'It smells horrible': Kasol, once the jewel of Parvati Valley, now a dumping ground
content: Viral videos are exposing a severe waste management crisis in Kasol, Himachal Pradesh, once celebrated as a pristine natural haven. The footage reveals alarming amounts of plastic and non-biodegradable waste polluting the forested areas, sparking public outrage. The situation highlights the detrimental impact of irresponsible tourism and ineffective governance on the region's ecological balance, prompting calls for immediate action

title: Watch: Railway employee makes e-rickshaw driver do sit-ups for crossing closed tracks
content: In Lakhimpur Kheri, Uttar Pradesh, an e-rickshaw driver's attempt to cross a railway crossing during a red signal resulted in his vehicle getting stuck on the tracks. A vigilant railway employee scolded the driver and made him do sit-ups as punishment. The incident, captured on video and shared widely, prompted intervention from the GRP and Railway Seva, averting a potential accident.

title: Woman Sides With Son Over Property, 2 Sisters Slit Her Throat With Knife
content: Two sisters murdered their mother by slitting her throat in Delhi's Ranhola area after she allegedly sided with their brother in a dispute over the division of ancestral property, an official said on Friday.

title: Sleeping Disorders May Signal Risk Of Parkinson's Disease, Dementia: Study
content: Sleeping disorders may act as an early indicator of neurodegenerative diseases like Parkinson's disease and Lewy body dementia (LBD) -- a type of dementia, according to a study.

title: Sleeping Disorders May Signal Risk Of Parkinson's Disease, Dementia: Study
content: Sleeping disorders may act as an early indicator of neurodegenerative diseases like Parkinson's disease and Lewy body dementia (LBD) -- a type of dementia, according to a study.

title: "Space May Not Cooperate": Veteran Astronaut's Warning To Shubhanshu Shukla
content: European Space Agency astronaut Thomas Pesquet, who had spent over a year aboard the ISS, offered advice to Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla.

title: "Violated Agreement": Trump Hints Fresh Trade Tensions With China
content: US President Donald Trump signaled renewed trade tensions with China on Friday, arguing that Beijing had "violated" a deal to de-escalate tariffs, at a time when both sides appeared deadlocked in negotiations.

title: As American Dreams Fade, How Asia Is Challenging US Supremacy In Education
content: As political dynamics change, Asia is stepping up to redefine the study-abroad landscape and to make a mark on it, reiterating and positioning itself as an upcoming and leading destination for higher education.

title: Division Between US And China Biggest Risk World Faces Now: Emmanuel Macron
content: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Friday that division between the two superpowers, the United States and China, is the main risk currently confronting the world as he emphasized the need for building new coalitions between Paris and partners

title: Opinion: Opinion | IMAX-Like Churches, TikTok Gurus, Putin: Inside America's Murky 'Faith' Bazaars
content: Behind America's dazzling surface lies another nation - one that fasts and prays for national repentance, that warns of apocalypse, that casts out demons on TikTok and tries to raise the dead in church basements.

title: Ex-Lover Turned Blackmailer: Delhi Police Arrest Man For Threatening Woman
content: The man emotionally pressured the woman into sharing her private pictures and videos and later used them to threaten her.

title: Pakistani Actor Hina Bayat Slams Karachi Airport Over No Water In Washrooms
content: Pakistani actor Hina Bayat has slammed the Karachi airport authorities over the unavailability of water in the washrooms.

title: Ex-Assistant On When Sean "Diddy" Combs Threw A Bowl Of Spaghetti At Her
content: A former assistant to Sean "Diddy" Combs has alleged that she was repeatedly abused and assaulted during those eight years she worked with him, with the American rapper tossing spaghetti at her on one such occasion.

title: In Bengaluru, Man Bites Another Man's Finger For Splashing Rainwater
content: On Sunday night, Jayant Shekar was driving home when, unknowingly, his car splashed rainwater on another vehicle.

title: From Launch To Landing: Astronaut's Space Diary For India's "Gaganyatri"
content: As India prepares to send its second astronaut, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, to the International Space Station (ISS) aboard the SpaceX Falcon 9 Crew Dragon, the insights of veteran astronaut Thomas Pesquet offer invaluable perspective.

title: Adani Energy Solutions Bags Rs 1,600-Crore Transmission Project In Maharashtra
content: Adani Energy Solutions Ltd (AESL) on Friday said it has secured an inter state transmission project in Maharashtra worth Rs 1,600 crore.

title: Smart TV, Projector, Wearables: Rajya Sabha MPs To Get Latest Gadgets
content: Members of the Rajya Sabha will now get the latest gadgets to enable them to discharge their functions/duties. The Rajya Sabha MPs are entitled to get smart TVs, smart projectors, wearables and other gadgets.

title: Deputy Director Of Probe Agency ED Arrested In Rs 20-Lakh Bribery Case
content: The CBI has arrested Deputy Director of Enforcement Directorate in Odisha, Chintan Raghuvanshi, in connection with an alleged bribery case, officials said Friday.

title: Ankita Bhandari Story: She Refused To "Serve" VIPs. They Threw Her In Canal
content: Ankita Bhandari, a resident of Dobh-Srikot village in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district, had joined Vanantra Resort in Yamkeshwar as a receptionist in August 2022. Less than a month into her job, she was dead.

title: Russia Says Expect Ukraine To Discuss Ceasefire Conditions In Istanbul
content: The Kremlin expects Russia and Ukraine to discuss the list of conditions for a ceasefire in the war in Ukraine next week in Istanbul, its spokesman said on Friday, praising the U.S. role in mediating the talks.

title: India's GDP Grew By 6.5% In 2024-25, Q4 Growth At 7.4%
content: India's GDP grew by 6.5% in 2024-25 and the last quarter of the year, between March and April, saw a growth of 7.4%, the Centre said on Friday.

title: Border Forces Dismantled Pak's Surveillance System Piece By Piece: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday lauded the BSF for its resolute response to Pakistani aggression earlier this month and said over 118 enemy posts were destroyed and damaged in retaliatory action along the Jammu frontier.

title: Need to align schemes with NITI Aayog’s SDGs, says Lanka Dinakar
content: The chairperson of the 20-Point Programme Implementation insists on seamless integration of data across websites and dashboards, and working in tune with the Viksit Bharat and Swarna Andhra objectives

title: Relentless showers lead to copious inflow to reservoirs
content: Red alert issued for the Moozhiyar Dam with one shutter opened by 10 cm.  Shutters of the Maniyar barrage have also been opened

title: Palaniswami calls for exempting all gold loans from RBI’s proposed norms
content: He also welcomed the recommendations of the Department of Financial Services in the Union Finance Ministry that the RBI exempt small loan borrowers seeking gold loans below ₹2 lakh

title: Telangana police gear up to prevent communal tensions ahead of Bakrid
content: To tackle the problem of illegal cattle transport, inter-state and inter-district checkposts are now operational round the clock, each staffed with veterinary doctors

title: BSF troops foil Pakistani intruder's attempt to cross the International Border in Pathankot
content: In another operation on May 24, Border Security Forces neutralised a Pakistani intruder attempting to enter Indian territory in Banaskantha district, Gujarat

title: Farmers demand timely completion of desilting work, disbursement of kuruvai special package
content: Farmers say kuruvai paddy cultivation had declined in recent years and the authorities should encourage cultivation by expediting desilting work and disbursement of special package

title: Andhra Pradesh DGP Harish Kumar Gupta stresses need for a robust security set-up in Tirumala
content: At a high-level meeting, the DGP calls for putting in place a standard operating procedure for each security agency and formation of a dedicated disaster management team to respond to emergencies

title: SFI urges govt. to drop plans to privatise medical colleges
content: Claiming reports indicating leasing of medical institutions to private entities, union leaders said such a decision will hit students from marginalised communities

title: TMC condemns 'derogatory' language used by its leader Anubrata Mondal
content: In the viral clip, the Birbhum strongman is allegedly heard threatening the officer-in-charge (IC) of a police station in Birbhum district over the phone.

title: Practising yoga daily is vital for physical and mental health, says Chittoor District Collector
content: As part of the 11th International Yoga Day celebrations, Chittoor district administration hosts mega yoga event with 5,000 participants

title: KRV activists stage protest slamming Kamal Haasan for his remarks on Kannada
content: The actor’s statement that Kannada stemmed from Tamil has hurt the sentiments of people of Karnataka as it was baseless and false, said the KRV

title: BJP trashes reports of distributing vermilion, slams Mamata's choice of words against PM Modi
content: Mamata Banerjee has said what should never be spoken. No politician or elected representative should use a language... (she said) 'Is PM Modi the husband of every woman?' What kind of language is this?, says BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra

title: Kochi shipwreck: CM Stalin holds review meeting on environmental impact along T.N. coast
content: Mr. Stalin held discussions with officials from the Departments of Revenue, Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Fisheries, and the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board regarding the safe removal of plastic and other materials washing ashore in Tamil Nadu’s coastal regions

title: Desilting work, pest attack on palm trees dominate monthly meeting in Thanjavur
content: Farmers express displeasure over the manner in which the desilting work had been carried out at 300 places in the district; many palm trees afflicted with vadal disease

title: Daily Quiz | On the monsoons
content: The monsoon has come a week ahead of its scheduled arrival on the 1st of June. How well do you know the monsoon?

title: Isolated incidents should not tarnish Meghalaya’s image: Tourism Minister
content: Paul Lyngdoh defends State’s safety record after two recent tourist mishaps; forum calls for stricter trekking regulations

title: Assam arms licence policy recipe for communal violence: Akhil Gogoi
content: Former State Congress president Bhupen Kumar Borah said it could promote an American-style gun culture

title: Anti-dam protests spread in Arunachal Pradesh; villagers point to potential submergence of sacred Mishmi tribal cultural
content: The Ekhomey Mowo Welfare Society, based in Anini, the district headquarters, said the project was illegal as the mandatory free, prior, and informed consent was not obtained from the Gram Sabha

title: BJP protests decision to close Jan Aushadhi Kendras at government hospitals in Karnataka
content: The government’s move will result in closure of 207 such centres in Karnataka while permission has been denied for 31 applications following the decision to shut them down

title: PM Modi kept mum over issues plaguing Bihar: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Yadav took aim at Modi for not commenting on several pressing matters, such as the physical and mental fitness of Nitish Kumar, who heads the JD(U), a key ally of the BJP

title: IndiGo will comply with any government regulations, says CEO Elbers on wet leasing of Turkish Airlines planes
content: The airline is operating direct flights to Istanbul with two leased Boeing 777 aircraft from Turkish Airlines, having over 500 seats each

title: Ankita Bhandari murder case: Resort operator among three sentenced to rigorous life imprisonment
content: The murder had triggered protests by locals, following which the State Government formed a special investigation team to probe it

title: Mercedes-Benz presents two multipurpose vehicles to Parvatipuram-Manyam district in Andhra Pradesh
content: The multipurpose vehicles would be used as mobile Giri Bazaars and to promote government welfare schemes meant for tribals

title: Statehood Day: Tourists, residents should come together to preserve Goa's culture, heritage, says President Droupadi Murmu
content: President Droupadi Murmu said tourists and residents should adopt sustainable tourism practices and support local communities

title: CBI arrests bank officials in Bihar, Assam on bribery charges
content: Searches were conducted on the accused’s residential and official premises in Sitamarhi, Bihar, where incriminating documents were recovered

title: Four women deliver babies with help of mobile phone lights at government health centre in Uttar Pradesh
content: The preliminary findings suggest this occurred because the transformer at the Beruarbari Primary Health Centre had burned out three days ago

title: BrahMos chief stresses tri-sector collaboration to equip Navy cadets for tech-driven warfare
content: Dr. Joshi acknowledges value of experience from service officers joining DRDO through secondment, post-retirement roles or lateral entries

title: Siddaramaiah launches real-time 'CM Dashboard' for development monitoring
content: According to officials, the dashboard categorises state performance data into four primary sectors- Economic Growth, Legal/Judiciary Management, Infrastructure Development, and Citizen-Centric Governance

title: Pakistan targeted civilian areas in J&K, and Poonch suffered most damage, says Amit Shah
content: On May 29, he chaired a high-level review meeting for the Amarnath pilgrimage and evaluated the security arrangements and preparedness for the pilgrims.

title: Column | Why is the Internet giving Lewis Hamilton a digital bath at the Ganges?
content: I am not sure if I want to be the one telling you this, but we are at an age where one can take a digital bath.

title: BJP core committee asks cadre to resist ‘targeting’ of its leaders by Congress government in Karnataka
content: BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra says Chalavadi Narayanaswamy was illegally detained in Kalaburagi district, FIR was filed against N. Ravikumar, and Hindutva activist Suhas Shetty was murdered

title: Kamal Haasan on controversial Kannada language remark: Won’t apologise if I am not wrong
content: Kamal Haasan has refused to apologise for his controversial Kannada language remark, which has received backlash from Kannada activists who have threatened to ban his movie ‘Thug Life’

title: SC takes suo motu case against YouTuber Ajay Shukla for ‘scandalous’ comments against sitting judge
content: A three-judge Bench of Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai, A.G. Masih and A.S. Chandurkar said in a short order that such remarks brought the institution of judiciary into disrepute.

title: Spat over parking turns into fatal altercation in Telangana’s Kothapet; police book case
content: The Chaitanyapuri police, acting on a complaint filed by the deceased’s wife, registered a case of culpable homicide not amounting to murder

title: Supreme Court directs NEET-PG 2025 exam be conducted in one shift
content: The bench, also comprising Justices Sanjay Kumar and N V Anjaria, said holding examination in two shifts creates "arbitrariness".

title: Nilambur bypoll in Kerala: CPI(M) nominates M. Swaraj as LDF candidate

title: WBSSC issues notice for recruitment of over 35,726 teachers in Bengal
content: In a significant clause, the notice stipulated the age limit from 21 years-40 years; the online applications will be received from June 16, 5 p.m. till June 17, 5 p.m.
